intro: Dendrobianthe longiscapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in a fine layer of hair. Dendrobianthe longiscapa typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
